headline.main: ULCER TEST FOR BATLLE; Uruguayan President Is Slated for X-Rays This Week

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 -- Unofficial sources have reported that the Uruguayan honorary consul at Hong Kong, Mauricio Nayberg, left for Peiping Dec. 6.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 -- Unofficial sources have reported that the Uruguayan honorary consul at Hong Kong, Mauricio Nayberg, left for Peiping Dec. 6.
docs.abstract: M Nayberg, hon Consul at Hong Kong, reptdly left for Peiping Dec 6; his family repts he said trip was 1st official Uruguayan mission to Communist China; Foreign Office silent

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: HONG KONG, Dec. 18 -- Uruguay's consular representative in Hong Kong was reported today to have signed a joint communique with Communist China's Foreign Trade Ministry expressing hope for a trade agreement between the two Governments.
docs.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, Dec. 18 -- Uruguay's consular representative in Hong Kong was reported today to have signed a joint communique with Communist China's Foreign Trade Ministry expressing hope for a trade agreement between the two Governments.
docs.abstract: accord voicing hopes for pact reptd signed, Peiping

headline.main: URUGUAYAN IN PEIPING; Envoy Reported Negotiating for Trade With Red China

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Iberia, Spain's international airline, yesterday contracted with the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation for two new Super-G Constellations. The purchase price was announced as approximately $4,000,000. Delivery date has been set for mid-1957.
docs.lead_paragraph: Iberia, Spain's international airline, yesterday contracted with the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation for two new Super-G Constellations. The purchase price was announced as approximately $4,000,000. Delivery date has been set for mid-1957.
docs.abstract: COMMERCIAL: Iberia buys 2 Lockheed Super-G Constellations for $4 million

headline.main: TRANSPORT NEWS OF INTEREST HERE; Iberia Buying Two Super-G Constellations -- Shipping Up on Inland Waters

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 23 -- Provisional President Pedro Eugenio Aramburu issued today a decree making all members of his Government ineligible for elective office.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 23 -- Provisional President Pedro Eugenio Aramburu issued today a decree making all members of his Government ineligible for elective office.
docs.abstract: Aramburu decree makes all members of current Govt ineligible for elective office; reassures nation it will freely choose rulers; reaffirms provisional nature of present Govt; decree supplements recent one barring mil men from election roles; nation's gains revd; some unrest noted

headline.main: ARGENTINE RULERS LIMITED IN TENURE; Elective Office Barred to All Current Government Aides by Aramburu Decree LIMIT FOR REGIME SET IN ARGENTINA

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROWSpecial to The New York Times
